content: this legal text summarizes a court case in the family court of henegouwen it discusses the impact of a collective debt settlement procedure on the financial obligations of the parties involved the woman argues that her debts which were erased during the settlement procedure were revived years later however the court rejects her argument stating that claims from former partners are allowed after the settlement procedure the court emphasizes that the settlement procedure does not prevent individuals from settling their own accounts therefore the womans exhusband is allowed to pursue his share of the joint debts that were settled during the procedure the ruling also applies to objections from various creditors clarifying the legal framework for settling financial disputes after the settlement procedure the court refers to relevant articles of the civil code and previous case law in making its decision the court also addresses the issue of interest claimed by the exhusband and determines that it is payable based on the date of the divorce summons the court orders the reopening of the proceedings to further clarify the breakdown of interest due
